Class Pacman

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.gridworld.actor.Actor
      • info.gridworld.actor.Bug
        • Pacman
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Edible

    public class Pacman
extends info.gridworld.actor.Bug
implements Edible
    Represents a Pacman character in the Pacman game Pacman moves according to user input
    Version:
    May 28, 2020
    Author:
    Shamita Gurusu and Cheryl Lin, Period: 2, Assignment: Final Project, Sources: none

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act()
      controls the movement of the Pacman - if user specifies movement, the Pacman will turn, otherwise it will move forward if it can.
      boolean canMove()
      The pacman can move only when the adjacent square is empty or if the adjacent square contains a bigPellet, smallPellet or fruit or ghost(only when the ghosts are blue, which is after the pacman eats a bigpellet)
      void eatBigPellet(BigPellet b)
      eats a bigpellet at a given location
      void eatFruit(Fruit f)
      eats fruit at a given location
      void eatSmallPellet(SmallPellet s)
      eats a smallpellet at a given location
      Fruit getFruit()
      gets the point value of all the fruits depending on the game level, used for getPointValue()
      boolean getIsPowerUp()
      returns boolean true if Pacman ate bigpellet and false otherwise, used in ghostclass to make ghosts edible
      double getPointTotal()
      returns the point total
      void jump()
      the pacman moves to the adjacent location, jump = move
      void lose()
      if the user loses the level, display the message "YOU LOSE!!! RESTART TO PLAY AGAIN" and resets the gameboard level
      void setPointTotal(double points)
      sets the point total
      void win()
      if the user wins the level, display the message "YOU WIN!!! RESTART TO PLAY AGAIN" and resets the gameboard level

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pacman

        public Pacman(java.awt.Color color,
              double pointTotal,
              info.gridworld.actor.ActorWorld w,
              int numBigPellets,
              int numSmallPellets,
              int gameLevel,
              Board gameBoard)
        Parameters:
        color - color of the pacman
        pointTotal - initial pointotal which should be 0
        w - the Actor world that the pacman is in
        numBigPellets - the total numberofBigpellets on the gameboard initially
        numSmallPellets - the total numberofSmallPellets on the gameboard initially
        gameLevel - the level of the game
        gameBoard - the gameBoard

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        controls the movement of the Pacman - if user specifies movement, the Pacman will turn, otherwise it will move forward if it can. the time dependent traits, like being in PowerUp mode and the appearance of the Fruit are controlled and turned on and off. user controls are also monitored in this method
        Overrides:
        act in class info.gridworld.actor.Bug

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove()
        The pacman can move only when the adjacent square is empty or if the adjacent square contains a bigPellet, smallPellet or fruit or ghost(only when the ghosts are blue, which is after the pacman eats a bigpellet)
        Overrides:
        canMove in class info.gridworld.actor.Bug
        Returns:
        boolean value of whether the pacman can move or not

      • jump

        public void jump()
        the pacman moves to the adjacent location, jump = move

      • eatBigPellet

        public void eatBigPellet(BigPellet b)
        eats a bigpellet at a given location
        Parameters:
        b - the bigpellet at a given location on the gameboard

      • eatSmallPellet

        public void eatSmallPellet(SmallPellet s)
        eats a smallpellet at a given location
        Parameters:
        s - the smallpelet at a given location on the gameboard

      • eatFruit

        public void eatFruit(Fruit f)
        eats fruit at a given location
        Parameters:
        f - the fruit at a given location on the gameboard

      • getPointTotal

        public double getPointTotal()
        returns the point total
        Returns:
        the point total

      • setPointTotal

        public void setPointTotal(double points)
        sets the point total
        Parameters:
        points - the number of points being added to point total

      • getIsPowerUp

        public boolean getIsPowerUp()
        returns boolean true if Pacman ate bigpellet and false otherwise, used in ghostclass to make ghosts edible
        Returns:
        isPowerUp boolean

      • win

        public void win()
        if the user wins the level, display the message "YOU WIN!!! RESTART TO PLAY AGAIN" and resets the gameboard level

      • lose

        public void lose()
        if the user loses the level, display the message "YOU LOSE!!! RESTART TO PLAY AGAIN" and resets the gameboard level

      • getFruit

        public Fruit getFruit()
        gets the point value of all the fruits depending on the game level, used for getPointValue()
        Returns:
        the fruit for the certain level
